author: Privatematrix
title: Cool little air racer
review:
Box: typical small set box, sealed with tape rather than thumb tabs. Box art shows the model manouvering  through some inflatable cones in a city harbour, a fairly typical scene for an air race championship. The box contains two unnumbered bags of parts, a folded instruction book, and a sticker sheet.

Minifig: Nothing new here, but serviceable. Stunt team coveralls on the torso, plain black legs, head with aviator glasses, red helmet and trans black visor with spare. 

The build: Fairly straightforward and conventional. 

Parts: A good selection of black, yellow and red parts as well as light bley and a few green hidden internally.  Also one blue 2 by 3 brick, visible at the front of the cockpit. Notable are the yellow wing plates, black wedge plates, and one of the brand new wheel arches in red.

Design: Very sturdy and solid, but like most LEGO planes from official sets, the wings and tailplane are too short. I extended the wings with two 2 x 4 yellow plates and two black 2 x 2 tiles and it looks much better. I also swapped the 2 x 6 black plate that forms the tailplanes for a 2 x 8. Some 1 x 1 yellow tiles complete the job.

My only other (minor) criticism is the landing gear, which is fixed in place and is quite bulky, but it stands up well to rough landings.

Prototype: The Red Bull air race series uses a  variety of high performance single engine monoplanes, so as far as this goes, it looks the part. This one is a tail dragger.

Functions: Canopy opens, prop can spin, prop clears ground in level take off run. 

Playability: Very swooshable, open the canopy, pilot in and out, spin the prop for takeoff. My son played with this for an hour once we built it.

Overall: Good solid addition to the city aircraft stable. I give this set an overall score of 4. It was detracted only by the too short flight surfaces and fixed landing gear, overwise it would be a 5. I would recommend this set.

author: Japanbuilder
title: Fun in the skies! And impulse buys!
review:
LEGO brings us a stand alone racing aircraft. Is it as fun as the concept sounds? Let's read on!

Contents:

The package looks attractive showcasing both the pilot and most prominently the aircraft he controls. A very nice looking box with the sky as the backdrop and what looks like an aircraft or floating landing deck on the back cover. Very fun. 

Inside you will find an booklet which is thicker than I expected, 2 bags and one sticker sheet with 8 stickers. 

Your left over bits will be the usual single studs and tiles and other miscellany. 

[url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwgtw][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/3/2173/32721895352_b59a5c08d3.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwgtw]P2132652[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

[url=https://flic.kr/p/S65ViF][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/4/3832/32875380645_26902c616f.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/S65ViF]P2132654[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

[url=https://flic.kr/p/S65Vtv][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/1/576/32875381215_388b39d116.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/S65Vtv]P2132656[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

[url=https://flic.kr/p/Rvpf6d][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/3/2008/32494194990_a7c6b5073c.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/Rvpf6d]P2132657[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

The Minifigures:

The minifigure included is fantastic. He has a great printed torso, front and back, and looks like he enjoys his job. 

[url=https://flic.kr/p/Rvpfa1][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/3/2885/32494195210_767b6285fc.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/Rvpfa1]P2132661[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

[url=https://flic.kr/p/RvpfbU][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/4/3908/32494195320_88c6dc2a1b.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/RvpfbU]P2132662[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

The Build:

The build is fun, and given the small size I was surprised by the little touches. The simulated engine exhaust the fun use of the new fender piece for the propeller housing and everything else accented with stickers just looks great. Plus those stickers were easy to apply. 

The Completed Model:

Excellent. For such a small set it actually manages to scale well with other planes in the City line and it sure looks the part of a racer. At first I thought the bulbous canopy piece would make for an awful look once the model was in hand but on the contrary it really brings the whole plane together and the pilot just looks wonderful within his little plane and getting a good view of him from all sides of the canopy really add displayability to the model as a whole. 

If I were to get picky about any one detail it would be the lack of a rear landing gear, but that is easily overlooked since the design towards the rear makes it impossible to affix anything without looking strange. 

[url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwgRW][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/3/2804/32721896652_5d767de38e.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwgRW]P2132664[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

[url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwgYu][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/3/2893/32721897032_72044fa737.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwgYu]P2132666[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

[url=https://flic.kr/p/Rvpfw3][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/1/565/32494196430_f0f19b87a1.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/Rvpfw3]P2132669[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

[url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwh4E][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/3/2113/32721897332_e018cc03ba.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwh4E]P2132670[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

[url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwgWf][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/3/2683/32721896902_6003ae9d57.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/RRwgWf]P2132665[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

[url=https://flic.kr/p/RvpfGo][img]https://c1.staticflickr.com/1/467/32494197030_3a75ff74e3.jpg[/img][/url][url=https://flic.kr/p/RvpfGo]P2132672[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/139708441@N07/]Macster Tome[/url], on Flickr

Final Thoughts:

This was a total impulse buy for me, saw it on the shelf and said why not? It looked attractive and fun. Put it together and sure enough my kids were off to the skies, they have not put it down yet. Totally worth it.

author: mini_mads1980
title: Solid Single-Seater Plane
review:
Introduction

This is part of the 2017 City theme which this year consists of only one aircraft not linked to other themes, such as Police (60138 – High-speed Chase) and the highly anticipated Jungle (60158 – Jungle Cargo Helicopter).

Box/Instructions

The box is quite deep for the part count, but appears to be the same as other sets this year. The front image has a nice city sky-line in the background and shows water in the foreground with a gate for the Race Plane to fly through.

 

The back of the box has four images of the pilot getting into his aircraft, taking off, banking and flying through a gate. I personally miss the old Hey! image on these boxes.

 

There is a 56 page instruction book – that works out as 1.8 pieces per page of actual instructions over 49 pages. 16 of the 43 steps to build the set only get you to add one part at a time, with another 13 steps of the instruction only adding multiples of one piece. I understand that this is aimed at younger fans of Lego, but my three-year-old can follow instructions with more than one piece on each step easily enough, so I wonder why Lego are making them so basic.

 

The instructions contain images of last year’s Fire sets, which seems a little strange.

 

You also get a sticker sheet containing 8 stickers.

 

Parts

You get a nice selection of colours in this set, with the contrasting red, yellow and black working well, but there are no real “stand out” parts in my view. The shorter wheel-arch is used to great effect as part of the engine housing.

 

Minifigures

 

You get one minifigure in this set. He has the standard pilot head, with a torso sporting the S logo that is printed on front and back. His legs are plain black and he wears a red crash helmet.

 

The Build

 

As mentioned above, the build is 43 steps and it feels you spend more time turning pages than you do actually building the aircraft. It takes between five and ten minutes to put together when you factor in a younger child finding and putting the parts together. The parts are mostly obvious for their positioning, after all is a small model and the wings etc can only go in one place. There is nothing in the construction that will cause any issues and it fits together solidly enough.

 

The Completed Model

 

The Race Plane is a lovely finished model, with the colour scheme working fantastically. I would only like to see one minor change to it. I think the pilot sits too far forward compared to where the canopy is. Currently the two front corners of the cockpit are open when the canopy is closed. There is a gap of three studs behind the pilot and the hinge for the canopy. Reducing this gap would improve the model and given it five stars from me. This would be an easy enough fix and could be made by extending the plane by two studs possibly.

 

The canopy looks great in relation to the wings, and simply pushing it forward looks wrong. However the pilot is pretty much pushing his head against the front of the canopy so the cockpit would need a slight amendment.

 

Additionally, the inclusion of two, maybe four, cones with poles in the top to act as a gate to fly through would have made it better.

 

Overall Opinion

 

Despite my slight criticism of the canopy I do like this set and with the parts being pretty standard I think you could easily source them in other colours to make Race Planes for this one to compete against.

 

This is certainly worth the £7.99 that it is sold for in the UK. I got this in Tesco at a discounted price which makes it even better value for money.

author: BlueGalaxy47
title: Amazing Apperance
review:
This is an amazing set. I love the look of the plane overall and the style of the plane. The colour scheme and stickers are chosen carefully, and the bubble capsule is used to good effect. I also love the look of the minifigure.

Nothing bad to say about this one!
